text.Department of Modern Languages and Liter: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

li.Completion of FRE 2201 with a \"C\" (2.0: Completion of FRE 2201 with a "C" (2.0) or better.
li.For degree-seeking students, certificate: For degree-seeking students, certificates will be awarded only at time of degree completion.

courseSection0.text:
Admission Requirements
Completion of FRE 2201 with a "C" (2.0) or better.
Certificate Requirements
For degree-seeking students, certificates will be awarded only at time of degree completion.
Prerequisite Courses
FRE 2201 or equivalent

courseSection1.text0: FRT3140 - French and Francophone Literary Masterworks in Translation (3)
courseSection1.text2: FRT3810 - French Multimedia Translation and Interpretation (3)
courseSection1.text3: FRT3831 - French Legal Translation and Interpretation (3)
courseSection1.text4: FRT3830 - Medical French Translation and Interpretation (3)
courseSection1.text5: FRT4521 - Language and Culture through Francophone Cinema (3)
courseSection1.text6: FRT4801 - French Business Translation and Interpretation (3)

li.A grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better is requ: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
li.At least 12 hours used in the certificat: At least 12 hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.Independent Study or Co-op credit cannot: Independent Study or Co-op credit cannot be used toward the certificate.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, military credit) may be used.

courseSection3.text:
Other Requirements

A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
At least 12 hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the department.
Independent Study or Co-op credit cannot be used toward the certificate.
No credit by exam (TSD, military credit) may be used.
